alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 31 at 6:33PM CST until January 31 at 8:30PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bastrop, Travis and Williamson. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Austin, Round Rock, Pflugerville, Taylor, Elgin, Windemere, Hutto, Manor, Thrall, Coupland, Granger Dam, Hornsby Bend, Webberville, Rices Crossing, Beyarsville, Noack, Waterloo, Hoxie, Sandoval and Wells Branch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
